content.thinking: Let me analyze this document and extract the text I can see. From the document, I can identify: 1. Heading: "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" 2. Sub-heading: "IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL" 3. Further description: "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" 4. Number: "5983889" 5. Name appears to be: "CORTES ARIAS LUIS HERNANDO" 6. The document has a signature 7. There's a silhouette/photo area (blacked out) 8. Additional information: - "FECHA DE NACIMIENTO: 18-MAY-1956" - "PURIFICACION (TOLIMA)" (appears to be place of birth) - "LUGAR DE NACIMIENTO" - Height: "1.56" - Blood type: "O+" - Gender: "M" (Male) - "17-ENE-1978 PURIFICACION" (likely issue date and place) - "FECHA Y LUGAR DE EXPEDICION" - There's a fingerprint - A barcode appears at the bottom This is clearly a Colombian national identification card ("Cédula de Ciudadanía"), which is a personal identification document. Now, using the classification workflow, let me determine the appropriate category: 1. **TEXT EXTRACTION**: I've extracted the visible text from the document 2. **PRIORITY CHECKS**: The document is not blank and doesn't just contain links 3. **ISSUER IDENTIFICATION**: This is issued by a government authority (Republic of Colombia), not DIAN or Chamber of Commerce 4. **DOCUMENT FUNCTION ANALYSIS**: This is a personal identification document 5. **CATEGORY CLASSIFICATION**: Looking at the defined categories, this best fits "CECRL" - Official personal identification documents The document shows: - Individual identification terminology: "IDENTIFICACION PERSONAL", "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" - Personal biographical data: birth date/place, blood type, gender - Individual photo area (blacked out), signature, fingerprint - Government-issued personal ID number - Security elements: barcode, fingerprint This is a classic example of a personal identification document (cédula) from Colombia. Based on this analysis, the document falls into the CECRL category.
